newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan should not maintain large trade surplus--MOF.
newsitem.headline: Japan should not maintain large trade surplus--MOF.

text.p: Japan should not run a significant surplus in its trade account, Japanese Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka said in a speech on Tuesday.
"It is not permissible for one nation to be the sole winner (in global trade)," Mitsuzuka said.
Mitsuzuka added that, in general, if Japan continued to run a surplus it would result in the strengthening of the yen and eventually an economic slowdown and a decrease in exports.
He also said a continued surplus would lead to severe trade friction.
